article.headline: Rice 87, Nevada 75
article.story: HOUSTON (AP) -- Michael Harris and Jason McKrieth scored 18 points each to lead Rice to an 87-75 win over Nevada Wednesday night. Rice (17-7, 9-4 Western Athletic) got out to an early lead after shooting 60 percent from the floor to 33 percent for Nevada and led 41-29 at halftime. Nevada (16-8, 10-5) improved its shooting in the second half, hitting 44 percent of its field goals and making 5-of-11 3-pointers. Rice shot 57 percent in the second half and both teams scored 46 points, but Nevada couldn't overcome its first half deficit. Harris also had 14 rebounds and Brock Gillespie and Rashid Smith added 16 points apiece for the Owls. Morris Almond came of the bench for Rice to score 10 points in 10 minutes. Nick Fazekas scored 22 points and Todd Okeson added 19 for Nevada.
